description.description: A human-readable description of the database and its purpose

type.description: Type of database and version required by the application

databases.description: A set of databases required by the component

dependencies.description: A set of components and associated versions that this component depends on.

description.description: A human-readable description of the component and what it should be used for
A human-readable description of the interface and how it should be used.

ingress.description: Ingress configuration to allow the interface to be exposed publicly

internal.description: Indicates whether the ingress rule should be attached to a public or private load balancer

path.description: Path that the interface should be exposed under

subdomain.description: Subdomain the interface should be accessed on

url.description: The url of the downstream interfaces that should be exposed. This will usually be a reference to one of your services interfaces.

interfaces.description:
A dictionary of named interfaces that the component makes available to upstreams, including other components via dependencies or environments via interface mapping.

Interfaces can either be an object describing the interface, or a string shorthand that directly applies to the `url` value.

keywords.description: An array of keywords that can be used to index the component and make it discoverable for others

name.description: Unique name of the component. Must be of the format, <account-name>/<component-name>

default.description: The default value to apply to the parameter when one wasn't provided by the operator

description.description: A human-readable description of the parameter, how it should be used, and what kinds of values it supports.

merge.description: Whether or not to merge results from multiple sources into a single array

required.description: A boolean indicating whether or not an operator is required ot provide a value

parameters.description:
A dictionary of named parameters that this component uses to configure services.

Parameters can either be an object describing the parameter or a string shorthand that directly applies to the `default` value.

This is an alias for the `inputs` field.

default.description: The default value to apply to the parameter when one wasn't provided by the operator

description.description: A human-readable description of the parameter, how it should be used, and what kinds of values it supports.

merge.description: Whether or not to merge results from multiple sources into a single array

required.description: A boolean indicating whether or not an operator is required ot provide a value

secrets.description:
A dictionary of named parameters that this component uses to configure services.

Parameters can either be an object describing the parameter or a string shorthand that directly applies to the `default` value.

This is an alias for the `inputs` field.

depends_on.description: Specify other services that you want to wait for before starting this one

liveness_probe.description: Task run continuously to determine if each service replica is healthy

command.description: Command that runs the http check. This field is disjunctive with `path` and `port` (only one of `command` or `path`/`port` can be set).

failure_threshold.description: The number of times to retry a failed health check before the container is considered unhealthy

initial_delay.description: Delays the check from running for the specified amount of time

interval.description: The time period in seconds between each health check execution. You may specify any value between: 5s and 300s

success_threshold.description: The number of times to retry a health check before the container is considered healthy

timeout.description: The time period to wait for a health check to succeed before it is considered a failure. You may specify any value between 2s and 60s.

replicas.description: Number of replicas of the deployment to run

metrics.description: Metrics to be used to trigger autoscaling

timeout.description: The time period to wait for a health check to succeed before it is considered a failure. You may specify any value between 2s and 60s.

depends_on.description: Specify other services that you want to wait for before starting this one

liveness_probe.description: Task run continuously to determine if each service replica is healthy

command.description: Command that runs the http check. This field is disjunctive with `path` and `port` (only one of `command` or `path`/`port` can be set).

failure_threshold.description: The number of times to retry a failed health check before the container is considered unhealthy

initial_delay.description: Delays the check from running for the specified amount of time

interval.description: The time period in seconds between each health check execution. You may specify any value between: 5s and 300s

success_threshold.description: The number of times to retry a health check before the container is considered healthy

replicas.description: Number of replicas of the deployment to run

metrics.description: Metrics to be used to trigger autoscaling

services.description: A set of named services that need to be run and persisted in order to power this component.

build.description: Instructions on how to build the code into static files to be put into the `directory`. Builds will be done just-in-time (JIT) for deployments to ensure that environment variables are specific to the target environment.

command.description: Command to run to build the code

context.description: Folder to consider the context for the build relative to the component root

environment.description: Environment variables to inject into the build process

directory.description: Directory containing the static assets to be shipped to the bucket

ingress.description: Configure a DNS route to point to this static bucket

internal.description: Whether or not this bucket should be exposed internally vs externally

path.description: Sub-path to listen on when re-routing traffic from the ingress rule to the bucket

subdomain.description: Subdomain to use for the ingress rule

static.description: A set of static asset buckets to create and load with content.

tasks.description: A set of scheduled and triggerable tasks that get registered alongside the component. Tasks are great for data translation, reporting, and much more.

default.description: The default value to apply to the parameter when one wasn't provided by the operator

description.description: A human-readable description of the parameter, how it should be used, and what kinds of values it supports.

merge.description: Whether or not to merge results from multiple sources into a single array

required.description: A boolean indicating whether or not an operator is required ot provide a value

variables.description:
A dictionary of named parameters that this component uses to configure services.

Parameters can either be an object describing the parameter or a string shorthand that directly applies to the `default` value.

This is an alias for the `parameters` field.
